alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 09 at 8:06PM MST until September 09 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 806 PM MST, a streamflow gauge on Waterman Wash at Rainbow Valley Road has responded with flow exceeding alarm stage. The stage is at 5.63 feet with nearly 1000 cfs and rising. Runoff was from thunderstorms that produced heavy rain in along State Route 238 and within Waterman Wash basin earlier. State Route 238 has closed due to flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Goodyear, Buckeye, Rainbow Valley and Mobile. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 238 between mile markers 25 and 34. This includes the following streams and drainages... Gila River, Waterman Wash, Lum Wash, West Prong Waterman Wash and Rainbow Wash. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
